name: Function calling with JSON schema
whatItDoes: Lets an LLM return structured arguments that match a predefined JSON schema for deterministic tool execution.
practicalUseCase: A support bot can call a ticket API with validated fields instead of generating free-form text.

name: Structured outputs
whatItDoes: Constrains model responses to a strict output schema so downstream systems can parse results reliably.
practicalUseCase: An extraction pipeline can always receive valid JSON for invoice fields without custom regex cleanup.

name: Embeddings-based semantic search
whatItDoes: Converts text into vectors so semantically similar documents can be retrieved by nearest-neighbor search.
practicalUseCase: A docs assistant can find the right troubleshooting article even when wording differs from the user query.

name: RAG with chunking and citation
whatItDoes: Retrieves relevant document chunks and injects them into prompts while keeping source references for answers.
practicalUseCase: An internal policy assistant can answer leave questions and cite the exact handbook section used.

name: Hybrid retrieval (BM25 + dense vectors)
whatItDoes: Combines sparse lexical search and dense semantic search to improve recall across exact terms and paraphrases.
practicalUseCase: A legal search app can match exact clause IDs and also find conceptually similar precedent language.

name: Prompt caching
whatItDoes: Reuses cached prompt prefixes so repeated requests reduce token processing cost and response time.
practicalUseCase: A multi-turn app with a long system prompt can cut costs when many users share the same context block.

name: Batch API processing
whatItDoes: Submits large volumes of offline requests in one batch job to process data more cheaply at scale.
practicalUseCase: A content team can classify 100,000 product descriptions overnight instead of sending real-time calls.

name: Streaming token responses
whatItDoes: Delivers model output incrementally as tokens are generated so users see progress immediately.
practicalUseCase: A chat UI can show answers in real time to reduce perceived latency on long completions.

name: Conversation memory summarization
whatItDoes: Compresses prior turns into concise state summaries to preserve context while controlling token growth.
practicalUseCase: A customer success agent can remember account history over long chats without exceeding context limits.

name: ReAct tool-use prompting
whatItDoes: Alternates reasoning and actions so the model can decide when to call tools and when to answer directly.
practicalUseCase: A research agent can search the web, inspect results, and then synthesize a grounded response.

name: OpenAPI-to-tool conversion
whatItDoes: Transforms OpenAPI specs into callable tool definitions so agents can invoke REST APIs safely.
practicalUseCase: An operations assistant can trigger shipping API endpoints using validated request parameters.

name: Model context protocol server integration
whatItDoes: Connects agents to standardized MCP servers so tools and data sources are discovered through a common interface.
practicalUseCase: A developer assistant can access Git, tickets, and docs through one protocol instead of custom connectors.

name: Guardrails with schema and policy checks
whatItDoes: Applies input and output validators to block unsafe content and enforce response format constraints.
practicalUseCase: A healthcare intake assistant can reject responses that include prohibited medical advice patterns.

name: Prompt injection defense for RAG
whatItDoes: Implements retrieval filtering and instruction hierarchy so malicious documents cannot override system behavior.
practicalUseCase: An enterprise chatbot can ignore embedded 'ignore previous instructions' text in uploaded files.

name: PII detection and redaction
whatItDoes: Identifies sensitive personal data in text and masks it before storage, logging, or model calls.
practicalUseCase: A contact-center transcript pipeline can redact phone numbers and SSNs before analytics processing.

name: Human-in-the-loop approval gates
whatItDoes: Requires explicit human approval for high-risk actions while allowing automation for low-risk tasks.
practicalUseCase: A finance agent can draft wire transfers but must wait for manager approval before execution.

name: Evaluation with custom test sets
whatItDoes: Runs repeatable benchmarks against domain-specific prompts and expected outputs to track quality over time.
practicalUseCase: A legal drafting assistant can be regression-tested on clause rewrite quality before each release.

name: LLM-as-judge scoring
whatItDoes: Uses a separate evaluator model and rubric to grade relevance, faithfulness, or style at scale.
practicalUseCase: A marketing copy generator can auto-score outputs for brand tone adherence before publishing.

name: Tracing and observability for agents
whatItDoes: Captures tool calls, prompts, latencies, and token usage so failures can be diagnosed quickly.
practicalUseCase: An SRE can trace why an agent failed by inspecting the exact tool call and prompt sequence.

name: Rate limiting and retry backoff
whatItDoes: Controls request frequency and retries transient failures with exponential backoff to prevent outages.
practicalUseCase: A high-traffic chat API can avoid cascading failures during provider throttling events.

name: Idempotent tool execution
whatItDoes: Ensures repeated action requests with the same idempotency key do not duplicate side effects.
practicalUseCase: A payment assistant can safely retry charge creation without double-billing the customer.

name: Long-document parsing with OCR
whatItDoes: Extracts machine-readable text and structure from scanned PDFs and images for downstream LLM workflows.
practicalUseCase: An insurance intake workflow can digitize uploaded claim forms before data extraction.

name: JSON mode output parsing
whatItDoes: Requests JSON-only responses and validates payloads before handing data to application services.
practicalUseCase: A lead-qualification bot can return strict JSON fields consumed directly by a CRM webhook.

name: Canary rollout for model versions
whatItDoes: Routes a small traffic percentage to a new model version before full deployment to limit blast radius.
practicalUseCase: A production assistant can test a new model on 5% of traffic and compare error rates before rollout.
